articles.title: India-Russia annual summit could boost bilateral naval partnership across Indo-Pacific region
articles.summary: The upcoming India-Russia annual summit on December 5 is set to significantly boost bilateral naval cooperation. Discussions will focus on additional joint exercises, enhancing military-technical partnerships, and fostering stability in the Indo-Pacific region. This strategic engagement underscores deeper defence ties and geopolitical collaboration between India and Russia, crucial for regional security dynamics.

articles.title: India and Russia in talks for Su-57 joint production
articles.summary: India and Russia are discussing joint production of the advanced fifth-generation Sukhoi Su-57 fighter jet, confirmed by Russia's Ambassador. This collaboration signifies deepening defence ties and could significantly bolster India's air power. For SSB aspirants, it highlights India's strategic partnerships and commitment to modernizing its armed forces with cutting-edge technology and indigenous defence capabilities.

articles.title: 25 Hollywood Favourites That Didn’t Make It Big Until After Their 30s
articles.summary: The article discusses how individuals achieve success at their own unique pace, using the example of 'super star celebrities' who experience breakout performances at diverse times in their careers. It underscores that one's path to prominence and significant achievements unfolds uniquely, reinforcing the idea that success isn't bound by a universal timeline.

articles.title: Live high school football scores for WIAA State Championships
articles.summary: The WIAA high school football state championships have commenced, with Divisions 7-4 competing on Thursday, November 20th, and Divisions 3-1 playing on Friday, November 21st. The tournament features top high school athletic talent from across the state, including two prominent teams hailing from the Oshkosh and Fond du Lac areas, all vying for the esteemed state title.

articles.title: The Beatles – Anthology Collection (2025)
articles.summary: The Beatles' "Anthology Collection" is re-released as remastered editions, comprising three original collections of rarities and outtakes compiled by George Martin. Available across six CDs, these editions, initially from 1995-96, offer enhanced audio quality. This release showcases the application of modern sound engineering to preserve and update historical musical works, making them accessible to new generations of listeners.

articles.title: India’s Matsya-6000 to begin sea trials at 500 m; NIOT scientists to pilot mission
articles.summary: India is set for a significant deep-sea exploration milestone. Early next year, two scientists will pilot an indigenously built, 28-tonne manned submersible 500 meters deep off Chennai. This mission marks India's entry into an elite group of nations with advanced deep-ocean technology, bolstering national marine research and resource exploration capabilities.

articles.title: Broken Indian Air Force drone found near India-Pak border in Jaisalmer
articles.summary: An Indian Air Force (IAF) unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) was found broken in a farmland near Jaisalmer’s Ramgarh, along the India-Pakistan border in Rajasthan. Police reported the incident involving an IAF asset in a sensitive border region. This raises questions about its operational status and the circumstances of its crash, prompting likely investigations into the cause.

articles.title: Advice from a Canadian billionaire: 'If you have money, give it away'
articles.summary: The Financial Post's series, "The Philanthropists," profiles Canadian business leaders who actively contribute to national development through their philanthropic endeavors. Featuring figures like Hal Jackman, the series highlights how successful individuals give back to society, fostering growth and addressing societal needs across the country. It underscores the importance of corporate social responsibility and civic engagement in building a stronger Canada.

articles.title: Advice from a Canadian billionaire: 'If you have money, give it away'
articles.summary: A prominent philanthropist has voiced opinions on various critical issues, including the implications of dynastic wealth and intricate succession plans within E-L Financial. The philanthropist also addressed concerns regarding excessive executive compensation, reflecting a critical perspective on current corporate remuneration structures and wealth distribution. Further details on these extensive remarks are anticipated.

articles.title: Today on Pinstripe Alley – 11/20/25
articles.summary: Baseball's offseason proceeds at its characteristic leisurely pace, with periods of quiet punctuated by sudden bursts of activity like player trades or team adjustments. The past week saw typical offseason developments, reflecting the sport's deliberate strategic rhythm. Aspiring officers can draw parallels, understanding that even seemingly slow periods in competitive domains demand critical planning and strategic foresight.

articles.title: Vietnam flooding submerges homes, kills 16, after relentless rain
articles.summary: Coastal Nha Trang, Vietnam, experienced severe flooding, with entire city blocks inundated and hundreds of cars submerged. Rescuers were actively engaged in plucking stranded residents from rooftops of submerged homes. This major natural disaster highlights the critical need for effective disaster response and resilience planning in vulnerable coastal regions, impacting civilian life and infrastructure significantly.

articles.title: Inviting G-d to dinner
articles.summary: Rebecca's painful pregnancy led her to consult a prophet, who revealed she was carrying twin giants, "geim," as detailed in the Torah. Sages further prophesied that from these two would emerge exceptionally brilliant individuals. This ancient biblical account highlights the themes of divine revelation and the significant historical lineage within religious tradition, crucial for understanding foundational cultural narratives.

articles.title: Russian Defence Minister Andrei Belousov inspects Vostok Group of Forces
articles.summary: Russian Defence Minister Andrei Belousov inspected the progress of missions conducted by formations and units of the Vostok Group of Forces. The inspection, which took place on November 18, 2025, aimed to assess operational effectiveness and ensure the successful execution of tasks within the ongoing special military context. This oversight highlights the strategic importance of the Vostok Group's operations.

articles.title: Australia Industry and Workers making the grade with US Virginia Class Submarines Submariness
articles.summary: Australia's Albanese Government, led by Deputy PM and Defence Minister Richard Marles, announced HIFraser as the first Australian company qualified to supply critical defence parts. This significant step bolsters Australia's indigenous defence industry and supply chain. It enhances sovereign capability, promoting self-reliance and local manufacturing of essential military components, which is crucial for national security.

articles.title: Navy Accepts Delivery of Future USS Harvey C. Barnum, Jr.
articles.summary: The U.S. Navy accepted delivery of the future USS Harvey C. Barnum, Jr. (DDG 124), an Arleigh Burke-class destroyer, from General Dynamics Bath Iron Works on November 17th. This significant acquisition strengthens the U.S. Navy's fleet with a state-of-the-art warship, enhancing its operational capabilities and global presence, marking a key milestone in naval modernization.

articles.title: BrahMos: India's most lethal supersonic cruise missile system may get another buyer
articles.summary: Indonesia has formally requested to acquire India's advanced BrahMos supersonic cruise missile system. This significant development, confirmed by Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, underscores India's growing stature as a defence exporter and highlights the capabilities of indigenous-partnered defence technology. It also signals strengthening defence ties between India and Indonesia, impacting regional security dynamics.

articles.title: UPSC Quiz – 2025 : IASbaba’s Daily Current Affairs Quiz 20th November 2025
articles.summary: This platform offers daily current affairs quizzes, drawing questions from vital sources like The Hindu, Indian Express, and PIB. These resources are crucial for UPSC Prelims, aiding aspirants in staying updated on significant national and international developments. It provides an effective tool for knowledge testing and comprehensive exam preparation.

articles.title: 2Africa Submarine Cable’s Core Infrastructure Completed China Mobile International Advances Africa’s Digital Intelligence Development
articles.summary: China Mobile International (CMI) and seven global partners, including Meta and Vodafone Group, are collaborating on a significant international telecommunications infrastructure project. This initiative, likely a new submarine cable system, aims to substantially enhance global digital connectivity and bandwidth. Such large-scale tech alliances are crucial for future digital economies and international data flow.

articles.title: India's Defence Production Up 174% To Hit Record Rs 1.27 Lakh Crore, Boosting Aatmanirbhar Push
articles.summary: India has achieved another significant milestone in its journey towards self-reliance in defence production. This crucial progress aims to drastically reduce the nation's dependency on foreign countries for military hardware, strongly aligning with the 'Make-In-India' initiative. Such advancements are vital for enhancing national security, promoting strategic autonomy, and strengthening indigenous manufacturing capabilities for the armed forces.

articles.title: Canada’s instructions to submarine contract bidders highlight sustainment, economic benefits
articles.summary: Canada has formally issued firm bidding instructions to two companies, including ThyssenKrupp Marine Systems (TKMS), for constructing its navy's new submarines. This significant defence procurement initiative aims to modernize Canada's naval capabilities, crucial for maritime security. For SSB aspirants, this exemplifies how nations strategically invest in enhancing their defence assets and maintaining a modern, capable fleet.

articles.title: Israel says Palestinians opened fire in West Bank
articles.summary: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) reported that Palestinian militants opened fire on Israeli soldiers in the Nablus Governorate of the West Bank. The IDF was conducting an operation in the area at the time of the incident. This highlights the continuing security challenges and clashes between Israeli forces and Palestinian groups in the volatile West Bank region, a key point for understanding regional geopolitical dynamics.

articles.title: Lessons from Operation Sindoor will be posed as challenges at 'Swavlamban': Vice Admiral Vatsayan
articles.summary: The Indian Navy is leveraging crucial lessons learned from Operation Sindoor by converting them into specific challenges for the defence industry and start-ups. This strategic initiative aims to bolster the Navy's operational capabilities and foster indigenous solutions for critical defence needs. This move highlights India's commitment to self-reliance and technological advancement in maritime security.

articles.title: YouTube suspends SGPC’s channel for a week over video on 1984 Army action
articles.summary: YouTube has suspended the official channel of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) for one week. This action was taken under YouTube's policy guidelines regarding a video uploaded by SGPC. The content reportedly pertained to the 1984 Indian Army action, which YouTube deemed to violate its policies, impacting the prominent Sikh religious body's online presence.
